EmoteActions.Message: RoadsNuhmudira2@03
RoadsNuhmudira3@03
RoadsComplete
AbandonedNuhmudira
What have we here? An errand runner from the High Queen. Sent by that whimpering waste of a man, Antius. I know your face. I know your scorn. After all that I have done for our Race, for our people.
Nuhmudira shakes her head. "You abandon me to death at the hands of that -- Empyrean! My memory is long, %s." She pauses.
Yet you come to me now and ask for help.
Very well, you will receive my assistance, but there is a cost.
RoadsNuhmudira3
RoadsNuhmudira2
RoadsNuhmudira1
Within the halls beyond are three objects that I require. I am not wont to leave my study of this place and have no students here at present to undertake this endeavor. You shall do.

I require a book from the library of this structure. It will appear as grand as the book that Asheron created. These people, while talented, were as degenerate and lavish as Asheron's ilk. To think, they would waste their arts on creating such garish items.
Collect the book and return it to me first.

When that is complete I will need you to collect a small trifle of an object. These people believed in interring their dead in a unique fashion. There is an urn within a crypt here. That urn contains organs that these people thought precious above all else. They belonged to the woman who sat as the head of this chapel and this order. Fetch that urn and return it to me. This will leave only the final task.

Lastly, this woman was once possessed of great power. She had the ability to sway masses, lead and inspire by her presence alone. Now she lies in a sarcophagus. Dead, bones rotting away while time presses them and their secrets into dust. I require her corpse. Bring this to me last, and I shall see that you receive what Elysa wants.
Elysa's clemency... is... appreciated.
Nuhmudira smiles wryly and ushers you toward your tasks.
SacrificedNuhmudira
USEDNUHMUDIRALIFESTONE@01
You... are not familiar to me in any way.
Nuhmudira looks you over. A simple flick of her fingers and you feel a wave of magic wash over your form.

Intriguing... Nonetheless, you come bearing news from Elysa. The very woman who wished me to never to return to -her- kingdom. A kingdom granted by an adoring populace that had known terror for years! A kingdom handed to her by a being unwilling, nay, unable to undertake the task himself because of paralyzing fear. You... are young. Misguided perhaps.

I am Nuhmudira, child. I am the creator of the sanctity that we Isparians are afforded on this world. For that, I am cast out because of baseless accusation and fear. It is a yoke akin to one I have borne since childhood. It is a curse that those with power must learn to bear.
RoadsNuhmudira1
RoadsNuhmudira2
I am not without generosity and compassion. Since Elysa has seen fit to forgive her accusations, I shall see fit to oblige her what she asks. But there is a small price.

Within this hall are two objects that I require to further my study of these unique people. The first is a book. It will be like many others in appearance. It will be located in the library beyond this hall. Bring that to me first. It will be indecipherable and foreign to your eyes. I will know it at once.

Second, I require a simple urn. It will hold the internal remains of the woman that held sway over the people here. She would have been interred in a very deliberate manner. These organs will have been preserved within this urn. Collect it and bring it to me after you have delivered the book and I will grant what Elysa desires of me.
Nuhmudira smiles wryly and ushers you toward your tasks.
RoadsNuhmudira2

Most impressive, dear child. You have pleased me greatly. Take this, it is a small token. You will need to craft it yourself. It is a pittance to make. You will need a fair amount of Burun blood to complete the process with the gem.
RoadsNuhmudira1
RoadsComplete

When you have found a large enough sample of burun blood apply it to the stone. The stone will drink the blood and take on the properties that will most harm the Burun. Affix the stone to your weapon or wand, and the magic will flow into the item. We will survive this latest threat, child. Fear not.
Because of your service to me in the past I want to give you a little more. Please, open your mind to me.
Go in peace child. Leave me to my task.
RoadsNuhmudira3@01

You've done all I have asked and done so without managing a scowl. You have proved that my faith in you was well founded. Leaves sometimes do turn over and show a brighter side, don't you think that is true. Do not answer. For your services, I gift you with this stone.
RoadsNuhmudira2
RoadsComplete

You will need to obtain a fair amount of Burun blood to enhance this stone. Apply the blood and it will drink the qualities in and become the antithesis. After that is complete apply the stone to one of the -Noble- weapons. It will assume the qualities and become a slayer of Burun.

I think that I shall prove that I mean well to us all, child. I know what has been occurring, the teachings of my former student, Ciandra. I have been watching from afar and here is a gift that I think will aid you. Open your mind to me.
Go in peace child. Leave me to my task.
RoadsNuhmudira2@01
RoadsNuhmudira3@02
Interesting, how did you come by this? it is a very nice gift. Thank you.
RoadsNuhmudira3
RoadsNuhmudira1@01
RoadsNuhmudira1@02
RoadsNuhmudira1@03
The book, child. I need the book.
The urn is next, child. Bring me the urn.
Are you a dullard? I told you, the book, the urn and then the corpse. You've brought me the book and the urn. I require the corpse, or you shan't have your precious stone.
I have nothing more to offer you now, child. Your discussion, while engaging, does little to aid me in my study. If there were more for you here I would make you aware. Please, be gone.
USEDNUHMUDIRALIFESTONE

In the past, your face has graced my nightmares. I have watched as you drew the life from my body, choosing to throw my efforts to the wind, rather than forgive the misguided way that I traveled. But I see that your heart has not always borne me ill. So I will grant you lenience.
RoadsNuhmudira1
RoadsNuhmudira2

Within this hall are two objects that I require to further my study of these unique people. The first is a book. It will be like many others in appearance. It will be located in the library beyond this hall. Bring that to me first. It will be indecipherable and foreign to your eyes. I will know it at once.

Second, I require a simple urn. It will hold the internal remains of the woman that held sway over the people here. She would have been interred in a very deliberate manner. These organs will have been preserved within this urn. Collect it from the crypt and bring it to me after you have delivered the book and I will grant what Elysa desires of me.
Elysa's clemency... is... appreciated.
Nuhmudira smiles wryly and ushers you toward your tasks.

Child, you come to me and ask a favor for the woman who has banished me from my home? Very well. She wishes to change these words, she wishes to make amends for her terrible slight, but she cannot come herself? What have I done for our people? Are my deeds so dark? Granting housing, providing the guidance and hope for our future... are these so minor that I should be cast aside like a useless rag for nothing more than supposition?
Nuhmudira shakes her head.
RoadsNuhmudira1

It matters little. You are here at the behest of Elysa, but you have proven to me before that you have the interest of all Isparians within your heart. I need one small task undertaken before I grant you with what you need.

Within the library of this place is a book. These people were efficient, not opulent. Far less depraved than the Yalain, yet their predilection toward creating magical devices was still tantamount. I have yet to determine the period in which these people held sway on this world, but their language is opening to me very quickly. Bring me the book that I desire. It should be on a table, though if they were anything like Asheron's people it will be a free standing object.
Be warned, the Moarsmen guard this place with their lives. The have dug tunnels beneath this chapel and enter freely. Retrieve this book and I shall see you rewarded.

Child, you come to me and ask a favor for the woman who has banished me from my home? Very well. She wishes to change these words, she wishes to make amends for her terrible slight, but she cannot come herself? What have I done for our people? Are my deeds so dark? Granting housing, providing the guidance and hope for our future... are these so minor that I should be cast aside like a useless rag for nothing more than supposition?
Nuhmudira shakes her head.
RoadsNuhmudira1

It matters little. You are here at the behest of Elysa, but you have proven to me before that you have the interest of all Isparians within your heart. I need one small task undertaken before I grant you with what you need.

Within the library of this place is a book. These people were efficient, not opulent. Far less depraved than the Yalain, yet their predilection toward creating magical devices was still tantamount. I have yet to determine the period in which these people held sway on this world, but their language is opening to me very quickly. Bring me the book that I desire. It should be on a table, though if they were anything like Asheron's people it will be a free standing object.
Be warned, the Moarsmen guard this place with their lives. The have dug tunnels beneath this chapel and enter freely. Retrieve this book and I shall see you rewarded.
You are doing well, child. There are still two object to be found. The second is the urn I mentioned before. Quickly now. My time is precious.
RoadsNuhmudira1
You are doing well, child. There is still the matter of the urn, then you shall have the precious gift that Elysa so desires.
RoadsNuhmudira1

Yes... I do need this child. But I was specific in my instructions, was I not? The book first. There are precautions that must be taken in an endeavor such as this. Please, collect the book for me. Then hand me the urn.
Another service out of the way and only one before you. The more time you waste with me, the more time your precious Queen needs to wait to have her desire sated. Quickly now, retrieve the corpse.
RoadsNuhmudira2

Perhaps I was not as clear as I should have been. You are to collect me three objects, in order: a book, an urn and then the corpse. This is of no use to me until I have the other two objects in my possession.
Return to me when you have deciphered my words and are prepared to accept the responsibility placed upon your shoulders.
You are helping me to decipher a question for which I have long searched for an answer. It may be the case that not all members of our race are worth saving.
Nuhmudira shakes her head.
Take this back.

I asked for the book, the urn and then the corpse. Write it down. This will help you to remember what I need and the order in which I need to receive them. Return to me when these instructions have made an impression.
Perhaps there is hope for you yet. You have brought each object to me that I have desired, with little protest. I am a woman of my word.
RoadsNuhmudira3
RoadsComplete

Find a fair amount of Burun blood and douse the stone. The stone will drink the blood and become a vile poison to the Burun. In essence, it will become a burun slaying device. Affix the resultant stone to a -Noble- weapon and you shall have what Elysa desired.
Now, begone.

As you turn to leave, you remember that Antius had wanted you to ask a question of Nuhmudira. You turn on your heels and call back. "Nuhmudira, did you let Oswald into the castle the night of the assassination attempt on Elysa?"
Oswald was given --
Nuhmudira gives you a stern look, "It would be wise of you to leave my presence now, %s."
RoadsUndercoverAntius
